pr_title: integrate prometheus-django library and add django as scrape target for prometheus
pr_body:
- Integrate `django-prometheus` library on Django container. Export backend database metrics on prometheus endpoint. Metrics are available as at `/prometheus/metrics`. 
- Adds a custom database engine to add monitoring for django databases. Custom database engine was designed because we have used postgres_psycopg2 as our backend engine. Prometheus built in library for django only supports postgres. Therefore, a new custom engine was built by extending the features of prometheus exporters by a wrapper class on the base class of the currently used engine.
- Adds django as a scrape target to prometheus. Now prometheus would scrap data from `/prometheus/metrics` from django and these can be plotted in grafana. A screenshot of plot in grafana of Leaderboard get api for 2XX responses in the last 5 minutes has been attached
![counter-graph](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55936223/120510842-7011ab80-c3e7-11eb-9811-a96700db5d64.png)

pr_title: Add CPU Metrics using Node-Exporter and setup Pushgateway for Prometheus
pr_body:
Add node exporter container and add it as a scrape target for prometheus. We are able to query for various CPU metrics that we need using prometheus and grafana now. Ready for deployment on staging. 
Setup a push gateway mechanism for prometheus in django and add a sample push metrics. Currently the sample push gateway mechanism is added for `get_all_challenges` api. Thus when a user hits this url, then the counter for http requests for this api is increased and the metric is pushed to pushgateway which can then be scraped by prometheus.
The counter is defined as total_http_requests which can be queried for the 4 arguments in any way: `django_app_name`,`endpoint_name`,`request_type`,`response_code`

pr_title: migrate statsd to monitoring instance and use it for queue monitoring
pr_body: Migrates statsd-exporter to monitoring instance. Earlier it was setup on the same instance as our evalai backend, but to maximize our performance on backend and provided maximum resources, we have shifted this to another instance where prometheus and grafana have been setup. Also, shifts monitoring submission queue from prometheus to statsd-exporter. Metrics are pushed for each queue when a submission is pushed into the queue and when it is processed by a worker

pr_title: feat: add authentication to monitoring setup
pr_body:
Deliverables:
- Prometheus and Alertmanager are authenticated using basic HTTP auth.
- Statsd-exporter is configured behind the reverse proxy and requests from staging.eval.ai are only allowed.
- Setup nginx container in dev monitoring env to mimic the staging monitoring setup

To-Do:
- Need to add `prometheus_staging.yml` to s3 as it contains secrets.
- Need to add `.htpasswd` file in s3 by generating one using the command `htpasswd -c .htpasswd <username>`.
